page.title: 03HIGH HURSTWOOD EMPLOYMENT
page.content: About 400 people live in the area but only around 50 work within it. Apart from a vineyard and one public house there is no commerce or business. The only work available is either in or connected with agriculture or in the residential institutions which have taken over some of the large houses for use as homes for the elderly or handicapped and in one case a private school. Th majority of people travel to work in nearby large towns or London. A minority of married women work outside their homes. Almost everyone takes it for granted that at least one car is essential and they do not therefore find it inconvenient or remote to live here although there are no shops, secondary schools or medical services within walking distance and virtually no public transport.
